alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 5:27PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Dallas County through 545 PM CDT... At 527 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near University Park, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dallas, Garland, Mesquite, Richardson, Rowlett, Wylie, University Park, Sachse, Highland Park, Sunnyvale and Buckingham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35E near mile marker 429. Interstate 30 between mile markers 46 and 64. Interstate 45 between mile markers 283 and 284. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central Texas.
